intro: Gnidia decurrens, commonly known as the narrowleaf gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Gnidia decurrens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
